metadata.description:
Deja Vu was my first record to cross 100k streams on any platform. 

This was an effort

More about PAISLEY....

In 2017, I had a thought, “patterns prevail”. It was derivative of a quote from my best friend and frequent collaborator, Sky Welkin, which read “passion prevails”. Sky is a talented cartoonist that embeds profound messages like this throughout his work.

During our college years, he’d often come by and draw while I made beats, this was our ghetto co-working era, and in these sessions we’d smoke, engage in discourse, and share ideas about the respective worlds we were building in our art. In fact, I was very much into doing something new each album, but Sky was the primary influence for me to get into world-building and having a particular sense of style that was cultivated over time.

In one of my college apartments, I decided that to let Sky use all of the walls in my room as a canvas - the few hundred dollars that I’d spend to have the room repainted when I moved was minuscule compared to the living art piece around me. Every so often I would discover some new character scene or phrase that he’d drawn without me noticing, but one of these phrases was placed in such a way that I couldn’t miss it as soon as I woke up, “passion prevails”.

Web3 has offered much in the form of expansion for the experiential qualities and monetization of my art. We always say things like, “time passes quickly in web3”.

As much as I agree, I find it interesting that time also seems to stay still - art is appreciated for it’s beauty regardless of age and with the possibilities available to me with NFTs, something like my debut album, can no experience a new form of appreciation.

As I begin to release works from the PAISLEY collection over time, it was only fitting that I began with the short film.

When I was working on the album, I connected with my friend and collaborator, Dawit N.M. to share the pattern theories I was creating from and what I was aesthetically into at the time. Dawit went on to handle the art direction for the album, as well as bringing my convoluted story concept to life as a film.

The story of PAISLEY exists in a universe in which we've all been made to forget true selves. Though, there are those of us that break free and reawaken, remembering all the knowledge of self that was once lost. A human that knows who they are can no longer be controlled and is thus a threat to those in power.

This is the case for our protagonists Figaro and Paisley. The pair, bound by fate, seek each other out in parallel universes with the hope to awaken their companion and continue their journey towards freedom. Our short film finds Figaro, moments after being awakened by Paisley, and follows them towards their attempted escape.

The PAISLEY album and short film are an allegory for patterns at every level of life. Just as cells make up organisms and organisms make up the planets, and the planets the universe, and so on - patterns, appear, reshape, and reappear until their purpose in your life is realized. In my album I explore the different patterns in my relationships and my relationships as patterns, that were required for me to grow individually.

This year marks the 3 year anniversary of the PAISLEY collection, with the short film has only been screened at live performances and intimate talks. Now it will all be immortalized on the blockchain.

lyrics.text:
(Intro)

See you in my rear view
See you in a dream from time to time
Now that you’re here boo
I don’t want to let you out of sight

See you in my rear view
See you in a dream from time to time
Now that you’re here boo
I don’t want to let you out of sight


(Chorus)

What should I do
With my dèja vú
Whenever I fall
I fall for you

What should I do
With my dèja vú
Whenever I fall
I fall for you

I fall for you
Like dèja vú

(Verse)

You’re so familiar
Knew you from a past life soon as I got near you
I could see it in your eyes
Reminisce another place another time
Show you nostalgia soon as I touch you, soon as you touch me
This isn’t nothing we’re on to something, we’re on to something

(Pre-Chorus)

This ain’t the first time
We’ve met in the first place
Maybe a past life
Magnets across space

(Chorus)

What should I do
With my dèja vú
Whenever I fall
I fall for you

What should I do
With my dèja vú
Whenever I fall
I fall for you

I fall for you
Like dèja vú
I fall for you
Like dèja vú

(Verse)

And you played it so cool
Like I couldn’t know you
At the same time see right through me
Even though I was disguised as the new me
Slipped down to our ego, got nowhere to be so
You ain’t gotta leave yo
Out of every woman on this timeline
I would choose your every lifetime
I know nostalgia sure as you love me, sure as you love me
This isn’t nothing we’re on to something, we’re on to something

This ain’t the first time
We’ve met in the first place
Maybe a past life
Magnets across space

(Chorus)

What should I do
With my dèja vú
Whenever I fall
I fall for you

What should I do
With my dèja vú
Whenever I fall
I fall for you

I fall for you
Like dèja vú

I fall for you
Like dèja vú
